page.title: 04Police
page.content: {POLICE }There are fourteen policemen in the village and they all have radios.{They have two police cars at {the station.}They have nine cells for men and three cells for women.{They {have traffic divisions for motor _ {cycles and cars.}They have fourty people working for the police station. {There are no police dogs in Lyndhurst {police station.}There are about 200 to 400 arrests per year.{There are 375 {accidents per year.}They have 20 to 30 ponies killed per year. {Stuart Austin, 8, John Hill,8. A policeman wears a dark blue uniform and helmet.{He wears it when on duty {so people know right away who he is. He can be seen walking along the street or in a police car, which has a blue light and siren.{His job is to, {look after people and their property, {and be around when people need him.
